headline: Homemade Sloppy Joes
description: These homemade sloppy joes are made with ground beef, onion, pepper, and ketchup. A thick and rich filling makes these iconic sandwiches easy to eat.

video.description: See how to make delicious sloppy joes from scratch.
video.name: How To Make Sloppy Joes

name: Homemade Sloppy Joes
recipeIngredient: 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place ground beef and onion in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir until beef is browned and crumbled, about 10 minutes.
Stir in green pepper and garlic; cook and stir until softened, 2 to 3 minutes. Add 1 cup water and stir, scraping the pan to dissolve any brown flavor bits from the bottom of the skillet.

Stir in ketchup, brown sugar, Dijon mustard, salt, black pepper, and Worcestershire sauce. Add remaining 1 cup water and bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until liquid has evaporated and mixture is thick, about 40 minutes.
Season with salt, black pepper, Worcestershire sauce, and cayenne pepper.

review.reviewBody: Made it 2 days in a row since it was so popular with the family! It was years since last time I thought of this.... Replaced 1/2 cup water with 1/2 cup Bourbon and added 2 tbs Molasses. Use Keto buns and Keto ketchup and added 1/2 can tomato sauce. Came out awesome both days.

This is my second time making this recipe, and I really do like it. The only real change that I make is to only use one cup of water. When making the sauce, I mix all the ingredients in a bowl first. After sauteing the onions and garlic for about three minutes in a medium high heat skillet, I add the ground beef and fry it off, and drain the fat. After adding the sauce it's only a matter waiting for the sauce to reduce. I cook mine in a cast iron skillet and don't have any brown bits stuck to the bottom of the pan. So no need for the extra cup of water that would only serve to dilute the sauce. Change the recipe to only one cup of water and I'll give it five duds stars.
I make it just as stated. We love it!
Love this recipe, it is our new go to. Only used 1 cup of water as it was perfect consistency without the second.

I have been making this recipe for years. Husband loves it and everyone else. I make it exactly like written except I don't use 2 cups of water I only use 1, and at the end I add I/2 cup of pepsi or coke, it kind of caramelizes the sauce.
My husband’s most requested version of his childhood favorite!
made this last night for dinner .... was yummy! Definitely won't be going back to canned :)
Home from work with the all familiar question, what to cook for supper? This recipe is easy and I had everything on hand. So no stopping at the store on my way home!! Plus, it tastes great!
This recipe is my all-time favorite!!! Only change for me is that I don’t use as much water. I don’t think it needs 2 cups.

I changed a lot as I've made this over time just to change the taste a bit. This last time I used a poblano pepper instead of the bell peppers and used a habanero to add a slight bit of heat. Also added a tomato (blended up) for a bit more of a fresh taste.
Just made

I made this last night and it was excellent! Just like I remember my Mom making back in the day. I only had one pound of ground beef so I cut the water to one cup and it came out perfectly. It did take about an hour for it to boil down. I added a piece of sliced cheese and a bit of cole slaw on top. This will go into my rotation. Thanks Chef John!
Way better than any manwich in a can. Although instead of the second cup of water i added a small can of tomato paste. Thickened right up.

With a few adjustments we loved it. I felt the first cup of water made it way to wet. Next time will use a fraction. Used tomato paste in place of ketchup. And added honey for sweetness. I made a double batch and had half to freeze. Will make it again for sure.

I love that I can make some childhood favorites and cut out the sugar! Thanks for this recipe! It is a keeper!
Really good recipe.
Very tasty! So much better than making with canned sauce. I did add diced onion and also substituted ground venison for the beef. Will definitely make this again!
Fast and easy. Good flavor
This is a great homemade recipe for Sloppy Joes. I follow Chef John and love everything he posts. I agree with other rafters in that it is too sweet. Will Decrease the brown sugar by half next time.
It was a big hit with everyone, I just added a tsp of apple cider vinegar otherwise followed the recipe! Yum!

i love it.....but made it just a little bit on the moister side with a bit more liquid..not too much just enough!

Great recipe! Especially if you are outta luck when you thought you had the can…. My boys all said “Mom don’t buy the can stuff anymore!” That should say it all.
I wish I could give a 4.5. I loved the tip on putting the ground beef in a cold pan to get a more fine meat mixture. I would cut back on the sugar though. They were too sweet for me.
My favorite sloppy joe recipe! I add more of the sauce ingredients and spices every time I make it. I also add red wine. I love this recipe and definitely recommend!

Chef John this is wonderful! That kind of thing that people just love and so easy too. What? You want Sloppy Joe for dinner? If it’s not too much trouble….(cue self silently chuckling cause it’s sooo simple). Great for young/new cooks, ingredients you almost always have on hand too. Perfect for a get together and freezes great! Holy cow, what’s not to love Thanks sir!
I doubled the recipe and only used 1 cup of water . I would suggest using 1/2 the sugar cause it was very sweet since ketchup is already highine sugar. My guest loved it !

I only used a half teaspoon of brown sugar and I added a teaspoon of chili powder and a half teaspoon of paprika. I also used a little dab of the beef Better than Bullion in the water so it would be more like beef broth. I think it gives it a richer flavor!

Yummmmm! Got a little carried away with the cayenne according to my husband, but otherwise we both loved it. No more canned sauce for me. Had 1 lb of hamburger so adjusted quantities on the fly, which resulted in it being sloppier but still with great flavor.

I made this recipe as directed except for adding 1 lb of ground turkey. I liked it but felt it need more flavor to make that “sloppy joe” taste come to life. 3/4 cup more of ketchup and 2 tsp of chili powder made this just perfect! I recommend only using 1 cup of water to avoid having to simmer sooooo long to get the sauce to thicken. Definitely use very lean meat.

I did keep the pinch of cayenne and my super sensitive can't even take a spicy dorito (and who can't do that?!) ...did not complain. I didn't add green peppers but did use 1/2 an onion. No one complained and half of my crew don't even like onions.

I made this recipe as is with the two following exceptions. First, I replaced the ground beef with leftover lentils. Second, I omitted one of of the two cups of water, as the lentils ready contained moisture and did not need the extra water. I had to stir the lentils constantly for the full 40 minutes to keep them from sticking and burning but it was so worth the effort and time.

These were so good my die-hard carnivores went back for second and asked me to make them again!

Thanks, Chef John!
My husband and I love this recipe. I used 2 lbs of hamburger. Making it today for the second time . A keeper!

It tastes excellent!!! 
My super picky eaters LOVED IT! 
Becareful towards the end because the beef dries up fast. mine were a bit dry. I wish I turned the heat off while there is still plenty of liquid. the beef absorbed the juice super fast!
This is my go-to recipe for sloppy Joes, I usually adjust the amount of water (second cup of water) dependent on how long I have to wait for it to evaporate.
This is our go to recipe for sloppy joes
Very tasty!!!! It wasn’t as saucy as I like but I would definitely make it again!!!

This recipe is a solid.

These were good and basic. But not the 5 star I'm

The best sloppy Joe’s we have ever had.

This was delicious! I actually used ground pork. I would recommend to only use 1/2 tsp of salt and I added 1/2 tsp cumin. I, too, used only one tbsp of brown sugar and it was still sweet so I don’t recommend the 2 tbsp. The cayenne pepper is a must! I used one tsp of it. Definitely is a keeper!

What a fantastic recipe! We loved it!!
It was pretty good. I never use canned sloppy joes. My only recommendation is to not use two cups of water. I only used one and it came out perfect. Oh and I’m Italian so I used 4 cloves ????
Best sloppy Joe I’ve had in years! Followed instructions exactly. Different than the sloppy Joe I grew up with but even better!!!

The sauce was much too sweet for us. Easily fixed w vinegar & hot sauce. The sauce was at the correct consistency before adding the water. I already omitted the cup of water w the veggies because it served no purpose. I wish I had not added the other cup of water to the sauce because it tasted like VERY watered down sauce. Luckily, I heated it up in a saucepan before adding to the cooked IMPOSSIBLE plant based ground "meat", to melt the sugar (which was not needed being so sweet), so I was able to fix it with double the sauce ingredients. Minus the water of course. Even then it was still watery but at least edible. Also, always cook your veggies until almost done to carmelize BEFORE the meat. Remove from pan, add meat, cook half way or so, then add veggies. Never add water to sauteed veggies, you'll just end up with soggy, no flavour veggies.

This tastes really delicious! I always add some minced onion and mushrooms to mine so I’m sneaking vegetables in to dinner! This was a tad bit too soupy at the end of 40 minutes so I might reduce the amount of water next time but overall this was a really good recipe.?
I dunno wut to say! No leftovers! As always you shared an awesome burst of flavors here! I NEVER EVER change,add or subtract a thing from your recipes. Thank you so much for table goodness.

Hands down the best Sloppy Joes I have ever made. I increased the worstershire to about 4 dashes, and didn't use any cayenne pepper. Everyone LOVED it! I saved and printed the recipe so that I never lose it!
My husband does not like sloppy joes. I made them and he loved this receipe. It was a little sweet so I added 1/4 tsp. of apple cider vinegar. Would make it again
These are absolutely hands down the BEST sloppy Joe's I have ever eaten. I have made this recipe a dozen times by now. Haven't changed a thing. 10 stars!

I absolutely love this recipe. Since I found it a couple months ago (9-16-2020 actually), it's the only recipe for sloppy joes that I use. I don't change a thing. Making it again tonight for like the 7th time and thought I'd better get it reviewed! I even eat the leftovers the next day on Ruffle potato chips! Ruffles don't break as easy as regular chips, and this stuff is thick! It's fabulous that way too!
Keto -ified these! Used regular mustard, swerve brown sugar and I happened to have a red pepper on hand so I used that. We loved these! Will def make again in place of Manwich!
Awesome flavor. I only used one cup water but also only had one pound ground beef. So delicious

Delish! Subbed yellow mustard and maple syrup!
The flavor is fantastic! My family loves Chef John!!
The best Sloppy Joe I ever made. I followed the recipe. I was a little afraid to add so much water but it turned out perfect and I will definitely make it again

This recipe was delicious. I used ground turkey because it was what I had available. I also added diced red peppers, chili flakes, finely chopped portobello mushrooms, and a splash of rice vinegar. Family enjoyed this greatly. Will make again soon. Thanks for the recipe.
Very good. Used tomato juice instead of water, added a can of corn and sliced mushrooms. Only used 1 tbsp of brown sugar.

She talked it up so much 2 of my daughters want the recipe. My changes were I did not add the 2nd cup of water and I used beef broth instead of the first cup of water. Thanks so much for this quick and easy winner.
I also added vinegar to it as well!
Easy and tasty. My family raves over this. Never any leftovers.

I was trying to cut the sugar for a diabetic family member. Used tomato paste and only 1 Tblsp of brown sugar. It was still really sweet. I added a splash of lemon and lime juice. Still sweet. Added a bit of beef broth, a couple more dashes of Worcestershire sauce, and more Dijon mustard and it was finally okay. Family likes it more than I do.

This was a pretty good basic recipe, I cut the sugar in half and added 2 Tablespoons white wine vinegar. Next time I will use apple cider vinegar. Make sure you give it time to simmer. You can use regular mustard just don't add to much use the amount on the recipe.

Love how easy to make. One pot and a spatula. I am not a fan of green peppers so only used a half. Added Rotel, one can regular , love the slow burn. Left out cayenne pepper. Easy-peasy...able to a tang with stone ground mustard and light brown sugar for sweetness.... Will use this recipe again.

I am one of those weird people that hate sloppy Joe's from a can but I love homemade sloppy joes!! This is the perfect recipe!! Easy to tweak to your taste but the base is perfection!! My whole family loves these and I have teenagers and toddlers!

This turned out great! I’m a vegetarian so I used quorn grounds and veggie broth instead of beef.
This is a favorite and absolutely replaces Manwich. So easy. I use a dash of Siracha and some jalapeños in place of the cayenne powder for our kick.

This was really tasty with just the right amount of sweet and savory flavors. I did throw in a jalapeño pepper since my green bell pepper was too small once I cut out the bruised parts. I had to adjust my seasoning and spices since I used 2 lbs of beef (they’re sold in 1 lb bricks and I didn’t want to put the half pound leftover back in the fridge). As other reviewers have noted, if it’s too soupy, that means it’s not done cooking. Don’t rely on the cook time since that will vary depending on a lot of factors. Don’t turn the heat off after 45 mins if you still see liquids. How lean your meat is also matters. I only had 85% lean ground beef so I had to skim off a lot of grease/fat in order for my Sloppy Joe to not be a soupy mess. My husband and I really enjoyed this on homemade hamburger buns (another Chef John recipe) and a slice of cheddar cheese. Will be making this again!
I just made it. It’s pretty sweet for my liking, but not bad.
classic flavor. i loved it!
It was delicious, I did not make any substitutes, it is perfect the way it is. My family loved the flavor.
I used ground turkey, and tomato paste instead of ketchup. Used slightly more brown sugar and Worcestershire sauce. Was a hit with the entire family. Will certainly make it again.
very good and simple to make!
I didn't add the second cup of water and I drained the hamburg. Flavor is great.
